Description: Blue glazed composition shabti of Wsr-h3t-ms with black painted detail: a lappet-wig tied with a fillet, a modelled face and crossed arms in relief holding two hoes; the front of the leg section is inscribed with a column of black painted Hieroglyphs; the back is decorated with a representation of a low-slung seed-basket.
Condition: fair - glaze worn on head, cracked at waist and knee level
Acquisition name: Donated by: Government of the British Protectorate of Egypt
